name: iPhone
description: Apple's original iPhone introduced multi-touch and combined an iPod, phone and internet communicator into one device.
fun_facts: First iPhone did not support third-party native apps — only web apps.
Announced by Steve Jobs on January 9, 2007, at Macworld.

name: iPhone 3G
description: Introduced 3G data and the App Store, greatly expanding phone capabilities and third-party software availability.
fun_facts: The App Store launched with iPhone OS 2, enabling native third-party apps.
Much of its design emphasized connectivity and location-based services.

name: iPhone 12
description: A major redesign returning to flat edges, added 5G, OLED across the lineup, and MagSafe accessories.
fun_facts: First iPhone to support 5G and MagSafe accessories (magnetic attach + wireless charging enhancement).
Introduced Ceramic Shield front cover for better drop protection.
